alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:43PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SHOWER WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN PIKE AND EASTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 243 PM EDT, a shower was located over Clarktown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, Waverly, New Boston, Piketon, South Webster, Rosemount, Clarktown, Lucasville, Franklin Furnace, Sciotodale, Beaver, Wakefield, Pike County Airport, Minford, Sciotoville, Omega, Givens, Stockdale and State Route 335 at State Route 776. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
